author: Richard Barley
title: How to Survive the Regime Change in Markets
text:
The dust appears to be settling in markets: stocks rebounded sharply last week. But compared with previous market wobbles, there are key differences. Central bankers especially will take this as an important cue.
The most notable development of the past two weeks: in the face of turbulent stock markets, with the S&P 500 dropping 10% from its peak then rebounding nearly 6%, government bond yields haven't fallen. The U.S. 10-year Treasury yield last week set a four-year high above 2.9%.
...
